intro: Hisingera mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Hisingera mexicana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils in full sun.
